vocabURI="http://lod.data-archive.ac.uk/skoshasset/a79b74cd-ce2a-435a-9250-ad5453874690">ZIMBABWE</keyword>         <topcClas>Economic conditions and indicators - Economics</topcClas>       </subject>       <abstract><p>Abstract copyright UK Data Service and data collection copyright owner.</p>The <i>World Bank International Debt Statistics</i> (previosuly Global Development Finance) contains more than 200 debt and financial flows indicators for over 130 countries that report public and publicly-guaranteed debt to the World Bank Debtor Reporting System. The database runs from 1970 onwards and covers external debt stocks and flows, major economic aggregates, and key debt ratios as well as average terms of new commitments, currency composition of long-term debt, debt restructuring, and scheduled debt service projections. <br> <br> These data were first provided by the UK Data Service in February 2004. The UK Data Service web site includes further information on its <i>World Bank International Debt Statistics</i> holdings, including a <a href="http://ukdataservice.ac.uk//use-data/guides/dataset/debt-statistics.aspx" title ="World Bank IDS dataset user guide">dataset user guide<a/> and details of <a href="http://dx.doi.org/10.5257/wb/gdf/2010-12" title ="World Bank IDS latest database updates">latest database updates<a/>.<br> <br> <b>Citation:</b> The bibliographic citation for the databases is: World Bank (<i>{YYYY}</i>): International Debt Statistics (<i>{date/edition of dataset}</i>). Mimas, University of Manchester. DOI: <i>{edition specific doi - e.g. <a href="http://dx.doi.org/10.5257/wb/gdf/2010-12">http://dx.doi.org/10.5257/wb/gdf/2010-12<a/>}</i>. <br> <br> </abstract>       <abstract><B>Main Topics</B>:<br><ul><li>total debt stocks</li><li>total debt flows</li><li>stock-flow reconciliation</li><li>resource flows</li><li>long-term debt</li><li>debt outstanding and disbursed</li><li>disbursements</li><li>principal repayments</li><li>net flows</li><li>interest payments</li><li>net transfers on debt</li><li>debt service</li><li>undisbursed debt</li><li>restructuring debt</li><li>debt ratios</li><li>macroeconomic aggregates</il><li>currency composition of long-term debt</li><li>average terms of new commitments</li></ul></abstract>       <sumDscr>         <timePrd>The data series start in 1970.</timePrd>         <nation>Multi-nation</nation>         <geogUnit>Countries</geogUnit>         <anlyUnit>Administrative units (geographical/political)</anlyUnit>         <universe>Cross-national; National</universe>         <universe>130 countries that report public and publicly-guaranteed debt to the World Bank Debtor Reporting System: Albania, Algeria, Angola, Argentina, Armenia, Azerbaijan, Bangladesh, Barbados, Belarus, Belize, Benin, Bhutan, Bolivia, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Botswana, Brazil, Bulgaria, Burkina Faso, Burundi, Cambodia, Cameroon, Cape Verde, Central African Republic, Chad, Chile, China, Colombia, Comoros, Republic of the Congo, Democratic Republic of the Congo, Costa Rica, Cote d'Ivoire, Croatia, Czech Republic, Djibouti, Dominica, Dominican Republic, Ecuador, Egypt, El Salvador, Equatorial Guinea, Eritrea, Estonia, Ethiopia, Fiji, Gabon, Gambia, Georgia, Ghana, Grenada, Guatemala, Guinea, Guinea-Bissau, Guyana, Haiti, Honduras, Hungary, India, Indonesia, Islamic Republic of Iran, Jamaica, Jordan, Kazakhstan, Kenya, Kyrgyzstan, People's Democratic Republic of Lao, Latvia, Lebanon, Lesotho, Liberia, Lithuania, Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Madagascar, Malawi, Malaysia, Maldives, Mali, Mauritania, Mauritius, Mexico, Republic of Moldova, Mongolia, Morocco, Mozambique, Myanmar, Nepal, Nicaragua, Niger, Nigeria, Oman, Pakistan, Panama, Papua New Guinea, Paraguay, Peru, Philippines, Poland, Romania, Russian Federation, Rwanda, Saint Kitts and Nevis, Saint Lucia, Saint Vincent and the Grenadines, Samoa, Sao Tome and Principe, Senegal, Serbia and Montenegro, Seychelles, Sierra Leone, Slovakia, Solomon Islands, Somalia, South Africa, Sri Lanka, Sudan, Swaziland, Syrian Arab Republic, Tajikistan, United Republic of Tanzania, Thailand, Togo, Tonga, Trinidad and Tobago, Tunisia, Turkey, Turkmenistan, Uganda, Ukraine, Uruguay, Uzbekistan, Vanuatu, Venezuela, Vietnam, Zambia, Zimbabwe.</universe>         <dataKind>Numeric data</dataKind>         <dataKind> Aggregate (macro) level</dataKind>       </sumDscr>     </stdyInfo>     <method>       <dataColl>         <timeMeth>Time Series</timeMeth>         <timeMeth>annual. These data are updated annually.</timeMeth>         <sampProc>See documentation for details.</sampProc>         <collMode>The World Bank web site has a <a href=http://www.worldbank.org/data/aboutdata/aboutdata.html>Data and Statistics</a> section which includes information about the data, methodology, definitions, country classifications and technical notes. Further documentation links can be found in the <a href= http://ukdataservice.ac.uk//use-data/guides/dataset/debt-statistics.aspx>dataset user guide.</a></collMode>         <sources />         <weight>Weighting used. Please refer to the <a href="http://web.worldbank.org/WBSITE/EXTERNAL/0,,contentMDK:22547097~pagePK:50016803~piPK:50016805~theSitePK:13,00.html" title="Terms of Use for Datasets">Terms of Use for Datasets</a> in The World Bank's Data Catalog.</conditions>       </useStmt>     </dataAccs>     <othrStdyMat>       <relStdy>2140 'CERN' Data Bank on World Experimental High Energy Physics, 1961-1984 </relStdy>       <relStdy>4814 World Bank World Development Indicators, 1960-2013 </relStdy>       <relStdy>6168 World Bank Africa Development Indicators, 1960-2011 </relStdy>       <relPubl>   </relPubl>       <relPubl>   </relPubl>       <othRefs>Language Of Study Description: English</othRefs>       <othRefs>Language Of Study Documentation: English</othRefs>     </othrStdyMat>   </stdyDscr> </codeBook>
